text: Dr. Cai, Wei, Valentin, and Paulina travelled to Montreal Canada for the Gates Foundation grant coordination meeting.
Dr. Cai was invited to Manchester for KTN Automation meeting.
Our collaborators from Autodesk visited our lab and the Foundry from San Francisco.
Dr. Cai was invited to Raymond and Beverly Sackler USA-UK Scientific Forum "Trends in Synthetic Biology and Gain of Function and Regulatory Implications" in Chicheley, UK
Emily attended the SynBioBeta conference in San Francisco, USA
Dr. Cai was invited to the Human Genome Project 2.0 meeting at New York, USA
Dr. Cai and Chantal attended the 10th International Conference on Genomics at Shenzhen, China
Dr. Cai was invited to give a seminar at Warwick Integrative Synthetic Biology centre (WISB)
Dr. Cai and Paulina visited GeneArt in Regenbursg, Germany.
Our collaborators from Autodesk visited our lab and the Foundry from San Francisco.
Dr. Cai was awarded a Frontier Innovator 0f 2015 by Wellcome Trust, and was invited to Wellcome Trust Collection in London.
Katarina Jonsson joined the lab as a PhD student, welcome!
Emily Scher joined the lab as a PhD student, welcome!

Dr. Cai was invited to give a departmental seminar (Department of Chemical and Biomolecular Engineering) at University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign.
Paulina successfully passed her 10 month PhD exam. Congrats!
Chantal and Dr. Cai were invited to present at The 4th International Synthetic Yeast Consortium Meeting. New York Genome Centre, New York, USA
Dr. Cai was invited to give a presentation at High Value Chemicals from Plants workshop. John Inners Centre, Norwich, UK
Our group was visited by Bio/Nano/Programmable Matter group from Autodesk Inc.
Our paper on "Smart DNA Fabrication Using Sound Waves: Applying Acoustic Dispensing Technologies to Synthetic Biology" published at JALA. Congrats to Paulina, Chantal and Sarah!
Dr. Valentin Zulkower joined the Foundry as a software developer. Welcome Valentin!
Lois OGUNLANA joined the lab as a undergraduate research assistant. Welcome Lois!
Dr. Cai was invited to Young Synthetic Biologist meeting in Tsinghua University at Beijing China.
our paper on Computer Assisted Manufacture for Synthetic Biology (YeastFabCAM) has been accepted at IWBDA2015, and we are selected for an oral presentation at this year's meeting in Seattle.
Dr. Cai was invited by BBSRC to attend the Synthetic Biology for Growth workshop in Birmingham.
our YeastFab paper has been published at Nucleic Acids Research ([url=http://www.synthsys.ed.ac.uk/news/yeastfab-offers-useful-tools-industrial-biotech]read Synthsys PR[/url] )
Our own Emily Scher has been awarded a prestigious 4 year Darwin Trust studentship to start her PhD in our lab this fall. Congrats Emily!
Our paper "Yeast Golden Gate (yGG) for efficient assembly of S. cerevisiae transcription units" is published at ACS Synthetic Biology.
Dr. Cai is invited to give a seminar at Agilent Headquarter at Santa Clara, California.
Dr. Cai is invited to attend DAPRA Biology is Technology conference in San Francisco.
We attended SLAS 2015 in Washington DC.

Our lab is part of £11.4M Edinburgh Mammalian Synthetic Biology Research Centre. (see [url=http://www.bbsrc.ac.uk/news/policy/2015/150129-pr-business-secretary-40m-for-synbio.aspx#.VMouUU0b-N4.twitter]BBSRC Press Release[/url])

Dr. Cai is funded with 2 grants of £4M funding to enhance National capacity for DNA synthesis, in collaboration with Cambridge, TGAC and Liverpool (see [url=http://www.bbsrc.ac.uk/news/policy/2015/150129-pr-business-secretary-40m-for-synbio.aspx#.VMouUU0b-N4.twitter]BBSRC Press Release[/url]).

Our paper "Intrinsic biocontainment: Multiplex genome safeguards combine transcriptional and recombinational control of essential yeast genes" is published in Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences (PNAS, see [url=http://www.ed.ac.uk/news/2015/switches-260115]Edinburgh Press Release[/url]).
Dr. Cai is interviewed by Scientific American to discuss [url=http://www.scientificamerican.com/article/new-life-made-with-custom-safeguards/]"New Life made with Custom Safeguards"[/url].
Our work on Biocontainment in yeast is mentioned in [url=http://www.nature.com/news/gm-microbes-created-that-can-t-escape-the-lab-1.16758]Nature magazine[/url]
Dr. Cai is interviewed by CNBC to discuss [url=http://www.cnbc.com/id/102344529]Gene Weapons[/url].
Dr. Cai is interviewed by CNBC to discuss [url=http://www.cnbc.com/id/102344529]Gene Weapons[/url].
Dr. Cai is elected as an Innogen Associate of Innogen Institute.
Our lab has been awarded £2.3M by BBSRC to develop Phenotyping Platforms for Synthetic Biology.
Our lab has been awarded £1.99M by BBSRC to work on the FoundryOS project: Building national hardware and software infrastructure for UK DNA Foundries.
Dr. Cai is invited to participate the UK-Canada workshop on Synthetic Biology in Montreal, Canada.
- 4th November, 2014, The Edinburgh iGEM competed in the Giant Jamboree at Boston and won a Gold Medal.
Dr. Cai is invited to visit the Systems Genetics Institute at New York University, USA.
Dr. Cai is invited to chair and present at the [url=http://www.globalengage.co.uk/synthetic-biology.html]Synthetic Biology Congress in London[/url]

Dr. Cai is invited to give a seminar in the National Institue of Genetics Japan.

Wei Liu attended the Oxford Synthetic Biology meeting.
Dr. Cai is invited to participate the BBSRC UK DNA Synthesis Mission workshop in Birmingham, UK.
Dr. Cai is invited to present at the EMBO Synthetic Biology of [url=http://syntheticbio.esf.org]Antibiotic Production II Conference [/url] in Sant Feliu de Guixols, Spain.
Wei Liu successfully passed her PhD qualify exam. Congratulations Wei!
Dr. Cai is invited to participate the UK DNA synthesis mission delegation to the United States, organized by BBRSC.
Our lab enjoys the first annual lab retreat in London with Tom Elli’s lab at Imperial College.
Dr. Cai gives a keynote presentation at XIVth International Union of [url=http://www.montrealiums2014.org/welcome_e.shtml]Microbiological Societies[/url]
Dr. Cai is invited to give a seminar at the Institute for Research in Immunology and Cancer, University of Montreal.

BGI announces first flagship project with the Edinburgh Genome Foundry to synthesize the largest synthetic eukaryotic chromosome in the UK [url=http://www.genomics.cn/en/news/show_news?nid=100063]read more[/url]
Dr. Cai is invited to give a presentation at [url=https://www.fab10.org/en]the Fab10 Barcelona Conference [/url]
Alba has been awarded a 6 year staff PhD studentship to start her PhD working on Crispr.
Dr. Cai and Chantal were invited to present at the 3rd International Synthetic Yeast consortium meeting in Sicily, Italy.

Vice president of Tianjin University Prof. Yingjin Yuan visit our lab and signed a collaboration MOU with the head of school. [url=http://www.synthsys.ed.ac.uk/news/synthsys-and-tianjin-university-collaborate-synthetic-and-systems-biology]details[/url]
Dr. Cai is invited to give a departmental seminar in the Institute of Genetics and Molecular Medicine (IGMM).
Our lab has been awarded a 3 year EraSynbio grant (€3.2M in total) to work on evolving synthetic yeast genomes!
Dr. Cai is invited to give a presentation on Edinburgh Genome Foundry at the SULSA Synthetic Biology Meeting.
Hugo Villanueva is invited to give a presentation at the SULSA iGEM Meeting.
Dr. Cai is invited to visit the Computer Science Department at Newcastle University.

Paulina Kanigowska has been awarded a prestigious EPSRC-Case studentship (the only one in the school of biological sciences!), co-funded by Life Technologies. This studentship provides 3.5 year full PhD studentship along with travel and research funding to Paulina. Congratulations Paulina!

Claire Chung joined the lab as an exchange undergraduate student from the Chinese University of Hong Kong. Claire is supported with a prestigious DREAM scholarship from her university. Welcome Claire.

Claire Chung joined the lab as an exchange undergraduate student from the Chinese University of Hong Kong. Claire is supported with a prestigious DREAM scholarship from her university. Welcome Claire.
Chantal Shen joined the lab as a new PhD student. Welcome!
Dr. Cai has been elected as an associate member in the Wellcome Centre for Cell Biology.
Dr. Cai has been promoted with early tenure.
Jackie Wang, a visiting scientist from Beijing Genomics Institute, joined the lab. Welcome Jackie!
Our lab is funded with a Wellcome Trust Institutional Strategic Support Fund award to start working on Edinburgh Parts Repository project.
Qi Feng, a visiting Msc student from Tianjin University, joined the lab. Welcome Qi!
Dr. Cai was invited to give a talk in the "Outlook for Synthetic Biology" meeting in Manchester University.
Dr. Cai was invited to give a seminar in the school of life sciences in Nottingham University.
Attended 2014 British Yeast Group meeting in Exeter University
